q: Indian Railway system is the ___ largest in the world.
desc: Indian Railways is the third-largest railway system in the world.

q: Which city has the longest railway platform in India and the world?
desc: Hubli in Karnataka has the world's longest railway platform, around 1.5 km long.

q: Where is the headquarters of the Central Railway zone?
desc: The Central Railway zone is headquartered at Mumbai CST.

q: The Eastern Railway zone is headquartered at?
desc: The headquarters of Eastern Railway is located in Kolkata.

q: Which railway zone has its headquarters at New Delhi?
desc: The Northern Railway zone is headquartered at New Delhi.

q: Where is the North-Eastern Railway zone headquartered?
desc: Gorakhpur is the headquarters of the North-Eastern Railway.

q: Which railway zone is headquartered in Maligaon-Guwahati?
desc: Maligaon-Guwahati is the headquarters of the North East Frontier Railway.

q: Where is the headquarters of the Southern Railway?
desc: Southern Railway is headquartered at Chennai.

q: Which railway zone has its headquarters at Secunderabad?
desc: Secunderabad is the headquarters of South Central Railway.

q: Where is the headquarters of South-Eastern Railway?
desc: South-Eastern Railway is headquartered in Kolkata.

q: Which railway zone is headquartered at Mumbai Churchgate?
desc: Western Railway's headquarters is located at Mumbai Churchgate.

q: Where is the East Coast Railway headquartered?
desc: East Coast Railway is headquartered at Bhubaneshwar.

q: Which zone has its headquarters in Hajipur?
desc: East Central Railway is headquartered at Hajipur in Bihar.

q: The North Central Railway zone is headquartered at?
desc: Prayagraj (Allahabad) is the headquarters of North Central Railway.

q: Which railway zone has its headquarters in Jaipur?
desc: North Western Railway is headquartered in Jaipur, Rajasthan.

q: Where is the South-Western Railway headquartered?
desc: South-Western Railway is headquartered at Hubli.

q: Which railway zone is headquartered in Jabalpur?
desc: Jabalpur is the headquarters of West Central Railway.

q: Which zone is headquartered in Bilaspur?
desc: South East Central Railway has its headquarters in Bilaspur.

q: Where is the Kolkata Metro headquartered?
desc: The Kolkata Metro is headquartered in Kolkata.

q: Which zone is headquartered at Visakhapatnam?
desc: South Coast Railway zone is headquartered at Visakhapatnam.

q: When did the first train run in India?
desc: The first train in India ran on 16th April 1853 between Bombay and Thane.

q: Between which two cities did the first train in India run?
desc: The first train in India ran between Bombay and Thane.

q: The Deccan Queen, India’s first electric train, was introduced in which year?
desc: India's first electric train, the Deccan Queen, began operating in 1929.

q: Which train has the longest route in India?
desc: Vivek Express travels from Dibrugarh (Assam) to Kanyakumari (Tamil Nadu), covering 4273 km.

q: When was Delhi Metro inaugurated?
desc: Delhi Metro began operations on 25th December 2002 between Shahdara and Tees Hazari.

q: Which is the newest metro opened in India as of December 2021?
desc: Kanpur Metro was inaugurated in December 2021, making it the newest metro at that time.

q: Vande Bharat Express is also known as:
desc: Vande Bharat Express is also called Train 18, India's fastest semi-high-speed train.

q: Where is the Vande Bharat Express manufactured?
desc: It is made by Integral Coach Factory, Chennai under the Make in India programme.

q: What is the length of the Delhi-Meerut RRTS corridor?
desc: The Delhi-Meerut RRTS is 82.15 km long and connects Delhi, Ghaziabad, and Meerut.

q: Which train is the first to be operated by a private operator in India?
desc: Lucknow-New Delhi Tejas Express is the first Indian train run by private operators (IRCTC).

q: As of December 2022, how many operational metro systems exist in India?
desc: There are 16 operational metro systems in India as of December 2022.

q: Which is the largest and busiest metro system in India?
desc: Delhi Metro is the largest and busiest metro system in the country.

q: What is the distance between rails in Broad Gauge railway in India?
desc: Broad Gauge in India has a rail distance of 1.676 meters.

q: Which gauge has a rail distance of 1.00 meter in Indian Railways?
desc: Metre Gauge has a rail width of exactly 1.00 meter.

q: Which gauge type has rail distances of 0.762 or 0.610 meters?
desc: Narrow Gauge has distances of 0.762 or 0.610 meters between the rails.

q: India has a road network of approximately how many kilometers?
desc: India has one of the largest road networks in the world, around 48 lakh kilometers.

q: Which is the longest National Highway in India?
desc: NH 44 is the longest National Highway in India, stretching from Srinagar to Kanyakumari.

q: What is the length of NH 44?
desc: NH 44 runs for 3745 kilometers across India.

q: Which National Highway is the shortest in India?
desc: NH 548 is the shortest National Highway in India with a length of 5 km.

q: What is the length of NH 548?
desc: NH 548 is the shortest highway in India, measuring just 5 km.

q: The NS-EW Corridor is part of which project?
desc: The North-South and East-West Corridor is part of NHDP Phase 2.

q: How long is the North-South and East-West (NS-EW) Corridor?
desc: The NS-EW Corridor is a 7300 km long expressway project.

q: Which city is the northernmost point of the NS-EW Corridor?
desc: Srinagar is the northernmost endpoint of the NS-EW corridor.

q: Which city marks the southernmost point of the NS-EW Corridor?
desc: Kanyakumari is the southernmost point of the NS-EW Corridor.

q: Which state has the maximum length of surfaced roads in India?
desc: Maharashtra has the highest length of surfaced roads in India.

q: Eastern Peripheral Expressway connects which states?
desc: Eastern Peripheral Expressway passes through Haryana and Uttar Pradesh.

q: What is another name for the Eastern Peripheral Expressway?
desc: Eastern Peripheral Expressway is also called Kundli-Ghaziabad-Palwal Expressway.

q: Which expressway is considered India’s longest greenfield expressway?
desc: The Agra-Lucknow Expressway is the longest greenfield expressway in India.

q: In which state was the Agra-Lucknow Expressway inaugurated?
desc: Agra-Lucknow Expressway was inaugurated in the state of Uttar Pradesh.

q: What is the Bharatmala project primarily focused on?
desc: Bharatmala is a highway, economic corridor and expressway development scheme launched by the Government of India in 2015.

q: In which year was the Bharatmala project launched?
desc: The Bharatmala project was launched in 2015.

q: Approximately how long is the road construction planned under Bharatmala Phase I?
desc: Bharatmala Phase I includes approximately 83,677 km of road construction.

q: Which location has been chosen for a greenfield major port under Sagarmala Project?
desc: A greenfield port is to be developed at Vadhavan in Gujarat under the Sagarmala Project.

q: Which National Highway connects Uri-Baramula-Srinagar-Kargil-Leh?
desc: NH 1 connects Uri to Leh via Baramula, Srinagar, and Kargil.

q: Which National Highway connects Chennai to Tuticorin?
desc: NH 32 connects Chennai to Puducherry and Tuticorin.

q: Which NH connects Srinagar to Kanyakumari?
desc: NH 44 is the longest north-south highway connecting Srinagar to Kanyakumari.

q: NH 5 connects which of the following places?
desc: NH 5 connects Kurnool to Chittoor-Ranipet.

q: NH 3 connects which two locations?
desc: NH 3 connects Fazilka to Mana via Patiala and Rudraprayag.

q: As per the National Waterways Act 2016, how many waterways have been declared as National Waterways?
desc: 111 waterways were declared as National Waterways under the National Waterways Act, 2016.

q: Which is the longest National Waterway in India?
desc: NW1 (Allahabad to Haldia) is the longest with a stretch of 1620 km.

q: NW2 runs on which river?
desc: NW2 (Sadiya to Dhubri) is located on the Brahmaputra river.

q: What is the length of NW2 (Sadiya to Dhubri)?
desc: NW2 runs 891 km along the Brahmaputra River.

q: NW3 connects Kollam to which location?
desc: NW3 connects Kollam to Kotappuram through the Champakkara and Udyogmandal canals.

q: NW4 passes through which rivers?
desc: NW4 runs between Kakinada and Marakkanam via Godavari and Krishna rivers.

q: What is the total length of NW4?
desc: NW4 spans 1095 km through Andhra Pradesh and Tamil Nadu.

q: Which NW connects Mangalagiri to Paradeep and Dhamra?
desc: NW5 connects Mangalagiri to Paradeep and Dhamra along the Mahanadi and Brahmani rivers.

q: What is the length of NW5?
desc: NW5 covers a length of 623 km.

q: Which National Waterway is on the Barak river?
desc: NW6 connects Lakhipur to Bhanga on the Barak river.

q: Paradip port is located on which coast?
desc: Paradip port is situated on the Eastern Coast of India.

q: Which port is India’s deepest port?
desc: Visakhapatnam is the deepest port in India.

q: Which port is the oldest and an artificial port in India?
desc: Chennai port is the oldest artificial port in India.

q: Which western coast port handles petroleum and iron ore?
desc: Mormugao port in Goa handles petroleum and iron ore.

q: Which port is India’s largest by volume handled?
desc: Kandla port in Gujarat is India’s largest port by cargo volume handled.

q: Which port is growing the fastest on the western coast?
desc: Jawaharlal Nehru Port (JNPT) is the fastest growing port on India’s western coast.

q: Which airline started operations between Mumbai and Thiruvananthapuram in 1935?
desc: Tata Air Lines started operations between Mumbai and Thiruvananthapuram in 1935.

q: When did Tata Air Lines start service between Mumbai and Delhi?
desc: Tata Air Lines began service between Mumbai and Delhi in 1937.

q: In which year were all private airline companies in India nationalised?
desc: In 1953, all private airlines were nationalised and Indian Airlines and Air India were formed.

q: Which two airline companies came into existence after nationalisation in 1953?
desc: Post-nationalisation in 1953, Indian Airlines and Air India were formed.

q: When was Vayudoot Limited established?
desc: Vayudoot Limited was started in 1981 as a private air carrier.

q: Which organisation was formed in 1995 by merging International and National Airports Authorities?
desc: International Airports Authority and National Airports Authority were merged in 1995 to form the Airports Authority of India.

q: What does the Airports Authority of India manage?
desc: The AAI manages the Civil Aviation Training College and National Institute of Aviation Management and Research.

q: When did the Indian government hand over Air India to the Tata Group?
desc: Air India was handed over to the Tata Group in January 2022.

q: Which international airport is located in Hyderabad?
desc: Rajiv Gandhi International Airport is in Hyderabad.

q: Where is Calicut International Airport located?
desc: Calicut International Airport is located in Kerala.

q: Which is the international airport in Mumbai?
desc: Mumbai's international airport is named Chhatrapati Shivaji International Airport.

q: Where is Kempegowda International Airport located?
desc: Kempegowda International Airport is in Bengaluru, Karnataka.

q: Which airport serves the city of Goa?
answer: Goa Airport in Vasco da Gama city
desc: The international airport in Goa is located in Vasco da Gama city.

q: What is the name of Kolkata's international airport?
pool: Netaji Subhash Chandra Bose International Airport
answer: Netaji Subhash Chandra Bose International Airport
desc: Kolkata is served by Netaji Subhash Chandra Bose International Airport.

q: Which airport is located in Thiruvananthapuram?
desc: Thiruvananthapuram International Airport serves Kerala’s capital.

q: Which city is served by Lokpriya Gopinath Bordoloi International Airport?
desc: Lokpriya Gopinath Bordoloi International Airport is in Guwahati, Assam.

q: Ahmedabad’s international airport is named after which leader?
desc: Ahmedabad airport is named Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel International Airport.

q: Which international airport is in Delhi?
desc: Delhi is served by Indira Gandhi International Airport.

q: What is the name of the international airport in Chennai?
desc: Chennai International Airport is the correct name.

q: Sri Guru Ram Das Jee International Airport is located in which city?
desc: Amritsar is served by Sri Guru Ram Das Jee International Airport.

q: Which is the first greenfield airport in Northeast India?
desc: Pakyong Airport in Sikkim is the first greenfield airport in the Northeast.

q: Pakyong Airport is located in which state?
desc: Pakyong Airport is in the state of Sikkim.

q: Which international airport is named after India’s first woman Prime Minister?
desc: Delhi’s airport is named after Indira Gandhi, India’s first woman PM.

q: In which city is the Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel International Airport located?
desc: Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel International Airport is located in Ahmedabad, Gujarat.
